channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bill Gates-backed Arnergy to expand solar access in Nigeria with $18M as demand surges
item.description: Demand for solar energy in power-starved Nigeria has soared in the last decade thanks to worsening grid reliability and rising fuel costs. That’s draw...

item.title: Black Basta: The Fallen Ransomware Gang That Lives On
item.description: After a series of setbacks, the notorious Black Basta ransomware gang went underground. Researchers are bracing for its probable return in a new form.

item.title: UK founders grow frustrated over dearth of funding: ‘the problem is getting worse’
item.description: According to Dealroom data cited by the Financial Times, British start-ups raised just £16.2 billion last year, far less than the more than £65 billio...

item.title: The Most Dangerous Hackers You’ve Never Heard Of
item.description: From crypto kingpins to sophisticated scammers, these are the lesser-known hacking groups that should be on your radar.

item.title: TraderTraitor: The Kings of the Crypto Heist
item.description: Allegedly responsible for the theft of $1.5 billion in cryptocurrency from a single exchange, North Korea’s TraderTraitor is one of the most sophistic...

item.title: Gamaredon: The Turncoat Spies Relentlessly Hacking Ukraine
item.description: For the past decade, this group of FSB hackers—including “traitor” Ukrainian intelligence officers—has used a grinding barrage of intrusion campaigns ...

item.title: Why It’s Impossible for Most Small Businesses to Manufacture in the US
item.description: American companies that make everything from keychains to mattresses say Chinese manufacturing is superior, and tariffs won’t be enough to shift produ...

item.title: Apple reportedly working on a Vision Pro that plugs into your Mac
item.description: Apple isn’t giving up on its mixed reality headset the Vision Pro, according to Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman. The company has been debating the best direct...

item.title: Tech tariff exemptions are only temporary, according to Trump’s commerce secretary
item.description: The tech industry may not be safe from new tariffs, according to U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick. The Trump administration announced Friday eve...

item.title: Access to future AI models in OpenAI’s API may require a verified ID
item.description: OpenAI may soon require organizations to complete an ID verification process in order to access certain future AI models, according to a support page ...
